title: Full Throttle Saloon Complete Series
description:
Full Throttle Saloon is an American reality television series that premiered on November 10, 2009, and originally aired on truTV.[1] The series, which takes its name from the bar, chronicles the daily operations of world's largest biker bar, Full Throttle Saloon, located in Sturgis, South Dakota is housed on 30 acres of land, which Michael Ballard purchased in 1999. The indoor/outdoor bar includes several large stages, a burn-out pit, a tattoo parlor, zip lines, a wrestling ring, restaurants, dozens of stores, hundreds of cabins for rent, and parking for thousands of motorcycles.[1] Open from late March/early April until mid-November (weather permitting), and is busiest during the annual week-long Sturgis Motorcycle Rally. Each year, the first full week of August marks the beginning of the Sturgis Motorcycle Rally , during which time, the Saloon can average 20,000 guests each night.The series aired its fifth season with TruTV on December 2, 2013.[2] After five successful seasons with the network, TruTV confirmed via Twitter that they did not shoot a sixth season in 2014.

Michael Ballard, Owner
Angie (Carlson) Ballard, (wife of Michael), Marketing director
Jesse James Dupree, Business Partner
Nigel Thomas Dupree 
Gregg "The Goat" Cook, Emcee
Eric "Senior" Soluri, Security
Fajita Mike
Members of Jackyl
